reviews.text: My first impressions were terrible - I was put in a tiny room which smelt strongly of cigarette smoke, despite asking for a non-smoking room. The room was small, and the bathroom was truly tiny and not too pleasant. I complained about the smell and was upgraded to a larger room which was better.
reviews.title: Not great but you get what you pay for
Look for something else
reviews.text: Bathroom still wasn't great, but it and the room were perfectly clean, if a little old and shabby. The main problem with the new room was the noise - you can hear everything and I had trouble sleeping with doors banging etc.

But for the price, it was adequate. The shuttle bus to the Metro is extremely handy and runs until 8pm so you get can a full day out sightseeing. Only takes a few minutes to get into the centre of DC. The staff were friendly and helpful. I might stay here again if I was guarenteed the same room but it would be risk in case I ended up with something more like the first one which I did not feel was acceptable.
reviews.title: For much lower than standard DC prices, the location and room were fine
WORST PLACE EVER STAYED
reviews.text: I stayed for 3 days in August 2004. The staff is ok friendly and the hotel is convenient, I'll give you that. But, if you want soundproofing, not to have people who make their permanent home next door, and no allergy aggrevation, I'd look somewhere else.

reviews.title: Are you kidding me!~!
reviews.text: The soundproofing is the worst, the other 2 I could sort-of live with. You can definitely hear the traffic outside and every word your neighbor is saying. The rates are cheap for a reason.

reviews.title: Worth budget price
reviews.text: Rooms just 'OK'. Desk staff exceptional, informative, helpful. Hourly shuttle to Roslyn metro stop. Worth it to call & ask to be picked up at Roslyn (daytime hours) to avoid taxi fares. Small pool. Great pizza shop next door. Will stay there again--no doubt.

reviews.title: Very convenient to D.C., good rates too
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here from May 21 - 25, 2004. It really felt like home, coming back to the quiet suburb every night after a hard day's sightseeing over the river in Washington, D.C., and yet it was probably closer to the sights than many B&Bs within the D.C. limits. It was also definitely the best rate we could find without staying in a youth hostel.

reviews.title: Good location for budget-conscious
reviews.text: Our room was large and very clean with a comfy bed and a good selection of TV stations. My only complaint would be that there is no soundproofing so you hear everything from the bathroom upstairs to firing practice at the fort across the road. Oh, and the pool is only open between Memorial Day and Labour Day even though it was 90 degrees the whole time we were there!
